title: Diary, reminiscences, and correspondence of Henry Crabb Robinson ...
author: Robinson, Henry Crabb
snippet: On the 6th of October I crossed the Channel, and on the 7th I reached London, too late to go to any of my friends. Having secured a bed at the Old Bell, Holbom, and taken a late dinner there, I went to the Procters', in Perceval Street, where was my old friend Mrs. Collier, and the cordial reception I met with from them cheered me. I returned to my inn, and was awakened in the moraing by thp shout of the vociferous newsmen, " The Lords have thrown out the Reform Bill ! "
